page.title: 10St. Mary's Church Brownsea
page.content: Brownsea Island is part of the parish of St. Peter's Parkstone. St. Peter's clergy administers this island church and also supply the choir and organist. The vicar is Reverend P.R.Huxham, and there is also a church warden who lives on the island. Services are held every Sunday afternoon at three o'clock from Easter until September and the church is open daily during this time. The church is used for christenings and weddings for the island residents. The most recent wedding was the warden's daughter. It took an ecumenical form. The oldest grave to be found in the churchyard was laid in 1869 and the most recent in 1984. The crypt has recently been discovered, containing one coffin.The church supports various charities,e.g."Save The Children"and has raised Â£1500 for Ethiopia.
